comment: Definitely recommend Professor Weinstein. He uses real-life examples and case studies to teach concepts. Don't need book. 1 page essay due before each class, but are easy. 3 tests & group project make up most of the grade. He gives you the info that will be on the tests. He wants students to participate & really cares about his students doing well.

Professor Weinstein is the most insightful professor I've had at KSU. He is so knowledgable from his real life experiences. You have a case study to read before almost every class and write a page about it, a capstone project, tests aren't hard, expects you to speak up in class, and does take attendance.

Busy work, but if you do it you will get an A; three tests, two of which you can bring your notes to. The first test he gave you the questions which could be on it and then picked a few. He's pretty funny and the lectures are interesting. I would recommend.

Dr. Weinstein brings a vast amount of knowledge as he is a Harvard Business School graduate. His class won't be an "easy A" but you will learn from this wise man. The daily business cases encourage students to THINK. These are done individually & then discussed in class on the day they're due. Class participation is graded. Exams are tough.

A waste of time with no value added to critical thinking or analytical reasoning skills. Lots of busywork and a writing assignment due every class. Does not teach just reviews the busywork. After talking with peers any other professor would have been better. Please care about your education enough to select a professor of better quality.

Terrible professor, doesn't teach just reviews what you read before class. Lots of busywork and work outside of class.  Weekly writing assignments.  Easily the most work of any class thus far. After talking with peers it seems as if any professor would have been a better experience. WASTE OF TIME
